page.title: 04The Lavenham Walk
page.content: In Lavenham we have a country walk,which starts at the bottom of High Street on the road leading to Bury St Edmunds.There are posts along the walk giving information and examples of the wild-life which may be seen.The walk was once an old railway line which linked Lavenham with Long Melford and is flanked by many trees and bushes.On the walk you will see farm animals,wild creatures and birds, as well as wild roses,hawthorn, sycamore and beech trees and some wild flowers. There are also several bird boxes and a bird table.The walk cuts across roads and fields and passes under bridges.Some village children use the walk with their friends as a playground,while adults use the walk to exercise their dogs.
